title: Mission Description
content: EnteringSampo's dream bubble, you realize that you have returned to thatdoctor's clinicinBelobog'sUnderworld, but this place is even more desolate than you remembered and far more suspicious.Before indulging your suspicions, you should do as Sampo suggested and adjust to the feeling of a dream within a dream.

speaker: Firefly
line: (Ugh... Where's this?)

speaker: (Trailblazer)
line: ▶ (Is this... the clinic in the Belobog Underworld? Why is it empty?)

text: How did I end up here?

children.speaker: Sampo
children.line: (This is part of my Dreamscape — Belobog is the setting for this dream.)

children.speaker: Sampo
children.line: (This is a surprise that will be revealed later. You have to remember — in a dream, anything is possible.)

speaker: Sampo
line: (No need to be hasty, now. You should take a moment to get used to the feeling of being in a dream within a dream.)

speaker: (Trailblazer)
line: ▶ (Is this... another note?)

children.text: Become the Garbage King Though the trash bags have long been broken

text: What do you mean by this?

children.speaker: Sampo
children.line: (I have no idea. I didn't come here when I had this dream.)

text: I think I've had this dream before too...

children.speaker: Sampo
children.line: (Oh, really? Well you know what they say — great minds dream alike!)

children.speaker: Sampo
children.line: (That's the thing about dreams — anything can feel familiar.)

speaker: Sampo
line: (Stop nitpicking the details. If you ask me, I'd say you should take a look outside. But don't get frightened by what you see!)

title: Step Description
content: Entering Sampo's dream bubble, you realize that you have returned to that doctor's clinic in Belobog's Underworld, but this place is even more desolate than you remembered and far more suspicious.You discover a note that is even more suspicious than the room itself — Just what does it mean? It seems that you will have to leave the clinic before you can get any answers.

speaker: Firefly
line: (What...)

speaker: Firefly
line: (...What's happening!?)
You're finally here...
Nice to meet you, dream diver...

speaker: Shatana
line: My name is Shatana, and I have a deal to offer you.

children.speaker: Shatana
children.line: Have you heard of... Tatalov the Garbage King?

text: Shatana? Are you related to Natasha ?

children.speaker: Shatana
children.line: Natasha who? I don't recall meeting such a person.

children.speaker: Shatana
children.line: Let's get back to the question... Have you heard of Tatalov the Garbage King?

children.text: That line of yours sounds eerily familiar...

children.speaker: Shatana
children.line: You're... probably just experiencing some déjà vu...

children.speaker: Shatana
children.line: Let's get back to the question... Have you heard of Tatalov the Garbage King?

speaker: Shatana
line: He's our king, as well as the manager of all the waste in this world. Perched on his throne, he uplifts trashcans that are humble and suppresses those that are violent. He's the cornerstone of Belobog, the lid that secures us, the barrel that reinforces us.

speaker: Shatana
line: However, since the thing from beyond the sky arrived here along with the Eternal Freeze , Tatalov's eyes have been blinded. He stopped listening to our calls, leaving the impoverished to be bullied and his loyal servants to be degraded...

speaker: Shatana
line: The humiliation was too much for us. We intended to help Garbage King mend his ways under the banner of the Skyfire ... But we were no match for the sinister king, who spread vicious rumors among the trashcans to divide us against each other. As a result, we could no longer communicate with one another using trashbags ...

speaker: Shatana
line: ...I implore your help to restore peace to the trash bags, so that the trashcans here may be united once more. Then, we'll be able to launch a counterattack against that undeserving king.

text: Are you saying you want me to rally you all together?

children.speaker: Firefly
children.line: (I think that's what she means...)

children.speaker: Firefly
children.line: (I think she's trying to say that you're the only one who can unite these, uhm, trashcans and lead their battle against the evil king... or something like that.)

speaker: Shatana
line: Well, that seals the deal.

text: What do I need to do?
But I haven't agreed to anything!

children.speaker: Sampo
children.line: (Dr. Edward said he didn't have the time to make any alternative storylines. Just accept it.)

speaker: Shatana
line: You have one mission — help the trashcans with their troubles and collect three Proofs of Trust .

speaker: Shatana
line: Once you've accomplished that, you'll become our new king and lead our fight against the evil king. Off you go, dream diver... Your mission is calling for you.

title: Step Description
content: As you leave the clinic, what lies before your eyes is a giant kingdom formed of trashcans. A trashcan by the name of Shatana finds you and asks for your help in freeing the trashcans from their worries and leading them to liberation — The prerequisite is that you acquire three Proofs of Trust.

speaker: (Trailblazer)
line: ▶ (I'm confused...)

speaker: Shatana
line: Off you go, dream diver... Your mission is calling for you.

text: There has to be a way...

speaker: Courageous Can
line: We've had enough of Tatalov's oppression! To retrieve our belongings from his treasure trove, the resources vital to our livelihoods seized by Tatalov's greed and tyranny, we must open this door.

text: Strange, you haven't done anything, but the door opens slowly — it turns out that this is an automatic sensor door. It just can't sense trashcans.

speaker: Courageous Can
line: The door is open... The legends are true! You are the savior destined to defeat Tatalov! The God of Trash sent you to return the tyrant's treasures to us!

speaker: Courageous Can
line: Ah, I've never felt so exhilarated before! When you raise the banner of rebellion against Tatalov, I and the other oppressed cans shall stand by your side!

text: You watch the trashcans excitedly crowd into the "treasure trove," tearing open bag after bag of garbage and pouring the contents into their torso...
This is a normal-looking trashcan. How magical! A kingdom of trashcans actually has an ordinary trashcan... This is a rare opportunity. Do you wish to do something to it?

children.text: Of course. That's the job of a trashcan. You chuck whatever random things you have on hand into its pitch-black and bottomless void. A series of loud sounds thundered back.
Of course. That's the value of a trashcan. When you used your finger to touch its sides, a burst of loud sounds followed.

...Evidently, this is not civilized behavior. In regular circumstances, you'd probably have to give up a Praise of High Morals ... However, this is the Dreamscape, so who cares? You feel your foot impact the can with a loud bam...

text: When you open your eyes again, the trashcan is no longer just a trashcan. It's now a trashcan... with arms and legs.

speaker: Trashcan Prince
line: Thank you, beautiful stranger. I am the Trashcan Prince, and my father was assassinated by Tatalov, and I was cursed into becoming a trashcan. You saved me from internment.

speaker: Trashcan Prince
line: I shall offer everything I have — my body, my soul, my life, even my trash bags — just to repay your kindness.

text: You talk like a Knight of Beauty ...

speaker: Trashcan Prince
line: There are many cans who compliment my beauty, but I am not familiar with the name of which you just spoke. The only knightly order in this kingdom is the " Knights of Loose Change ," each of whom is a noble and respectable can of the highest order.

text: Then stand with me against Tatalov.

speaker: Trashcan Prince
line: I will. I will stand with you and ignite the rising smoke of rebellion until the kingdom is saved from absolute peril.

speaker: Trashcan Prince
line: You have earned my confidence. I wish for you to accept this item and my heart as a token of my sincere gratitude. I will fight for you, O glorious soul.

speaker: Trashcan Prince
line: You have earned my confidence. I will fight for you, O glorious soul.

speaker: Serious Can
line: Then who is worthy of it?

speaker: Beautiful Can
line: Only I should have it!

speaker: Wise Can
line: This requires further discussion...

text: Three trashcans stand around each other, arguing ceaselessly about a certain matter...

speaker: Serious Can
line: Outlander, a dispute awaits your fair judgment.

speaker: Beautiful Can
line: This is the legendary golden trash, a symbol of power and status. Only the most qualified trashcan may lay claim to it. All of us feel that we are that trashcan, and so we keep fighting for it.

speaker: Wise Can
line: So, we have decided that an observer possessing unique and just insight should be the judge for this matter and decide to whom the reward will belong, and bring a conclusive end to this long dispute.

speaker: Serious Can
line: If you give the golden trash to me, I will pledge you endless wealth, more than enough to fill the biggest trashcan there is.

speaker: Wise Can
line: If you give the golden trash to me, I will grant you endless knowledge, more than any full bag of trashcan provide.

speaker: Beautiful Can
line: If you bestow upon me this golden trash, I shall promise you the most beautiful trashcan in the world — myself. I will stand beside you as a partner beyond peer and face all your trials and triumphs by your side.

text: Split golden trash into three and distribute evenly.
Amidst the watchful gaze of the three, you perfectly split the golden trash. Not even a Clockie Pizza can be divided this evenly.
I am the only one worthy of it!

children.text: Under the watchful eyes of the three, you claim the golden trash as your own. Indeed, among these small trashcans, is there anyone who stands as tall and upright as you do?

speaker: Wise Can
line: The conundrum that has stymied us for so long... fixed just like that?

speaker: Beautiful Can
line: Then who is the most qualified can... No, that no longer mattered [ sic ].

speaker: Serious Can
line: The outlander must be trying to help us understand how foolish this dispute of ours was... You have proven yourself with your actions. This signifies our loyalty and longing. We wish for you to have it.

speaker: Wise Can
line: We all approve of your intellect and justness.

speaker: Serious Can
line: You have proven yourself with your actions. We three cans shall become your aides, and win freedom once more for trashcans.

speaker: Beautiful Can
line: We three cans will become your aides, and win freedom once more for our people.

speaker: Trashiemedes
line: Ninety-seven thousand eight hundred sixty-three...

text: This particular trashcan stands quietly. Its lid has chipped and faded paint. It is meticulously counting the roadside trash, occasionally sighing or scratching its head, as if struggling to memorize an astronomical number.

speaker: Trashiemedes
line: ...Are you here to mock me too? Or are you seeking wise answers?

children.speaker: Trashiemedes
children.line: It's a long story. A long, long time ago, I angered Tatalov. I told him that even the most stable of nations has their day of decay, and even all the trash in the stars can eventually be counted. It is unclear which part of the sentence infuriated him...

children.speaker: Trashiemedes
children.line: ...As punishment, he assigned me this role, demanding that I count all the trash in the city. Before then, I am to never issue forth my opinions.

speaker: Trashiemedes
line: Oh... it's rare for a can to be so straightforward. I do possess the "Proof of Trust," but now it's lost in the mountain of trash.

speaker: Trashiemedes
line: If you want it, work with me. I have counted the majority of the trash in this city, leaving only these three newly arrived cans.

text: What sort of trash would Trashcan Kingdom hold? Curiosity piqued, you open the lid of the first trashcan.
Unfortunately, there isn't any difference. Maybe Dr. Edward did not have time to attend to these details.

There's a comic book inside this trashcan. The pages are torn and damaged. It tells of an adventure: Tatalov was once a brave trashcan. With valiance and willpower, it defeated a colossal junk monster and saved a human from its monstrous maw.
In order to repay Tatalov, that human turned himself into a trashcan... This is actually a horror story.
You see something unexpected — a True Sting, lying inside the trashcan, looking back at you.
It is time to rid the people of this menace — Use your bat to tell it that this is a Kingdom of Preservation !

children.speaker: Clear-Headed Can
children.line: Who dares disrupt my slumber!?

text: After a loud boom, Propagation's crisis has ended. The world is once again peaceful. And that trashcan who has endured undeserved ordeals has returned to his slumber. Thank you, Nameless!

speaker: Trashiemedes
line: Not bad, young can. You've proven yourself by your wisdom and patience... You deserve this Proof of Trust. I'll gift it to you.

speaker: Trashiemedes
line: I'm now old and frail, no longer able to fight by your side. Hopefully, my mind can still be of use to you.

text: A strange trash bag sits in the bottomless trashcan. You notice the "seal" on the bag — A few fish bones have clipped the mouth of the bag shut.
Bam! Green smoke wafts up from within the bag together with a loud noise. It twists and congeals in the air, slowly becoming a giant... trashcan.

speaker: Garboski
line: Finally — I am free! I am "Garboski," a can of unmatched evil. Tatalov used despicable means to defeat me and sealed me in this deep and cramped trash bag.

speaker: Garboski
line: For the first five hundred years of my imprisonment, I swore an oath that if a can came to save me, I would reward them with endless wealth. Then, for the next five hundred years, I swore that if a can saved me, I would reward them with endless trash.

speaker: Garboski
line: However, ten thousand years have passed. That's 20 five-hundred-year periods, but no cans came! Therefore, I swore that if a can came to save me, I would reward them with a painless death.

speaker: Garboski
line: — You've come, and so you now must die.

text: This is not fair! I saved you!

children.speaker: Garboski
children.line: Correct. I will now offer you a final mercy. You get to choose how you wish to die.

children.text: I wish to die as a warrior!

children.speaker: Garboski
children.line: Oh? No trashcan has ever dared to challenge me to a duel. I acknowledge your bravery... Perhaps there's no need to conduct a pointless battle.

children.text: Why not stand with me against Tatalov?

children.speaker: Garboski
children.line: Countless years of captivity have whittled flat my edges. My prime is long past, never to return. I only wish to past [ sic ] the rest of my life as a normal trashcan. Farewell, stranger.

children.text: I don't believe you were sealed in the trash bag.

children.speaker: Garboski
children.line: Ah, yes, Tatalov used the same trick against me. "With such a massive body like yours, how can a bag fit you?" And so I slipped into a trash bag before him and found myself sealed.

children.speaker: Garboski
children.line: Even the vilest trashcan is capable of learning to heed a lesson. Your tactics are ineffective against me now! Now, feel my ten thousand years — five hundred years times twenty — of fury!

children.speaker: Garboski
children.line: I didn't expect you to be so strong. I acknowledge your bravery... Perhaps there's no need to conduct a pointless battle.

children.text: Why not stand with me against Tatalov?

children.speaker: Garboski
children.line: Countless years of captivity have whittled flat my edges. My prime is long past, never to return. I only wish to past [ sic ] the rest of my life as a normal trashcan. Farewell, stranger.

text: But I'm a person, not a trashcan.

children.speaker: Garboski
children.line: You're right. You are not the savior that I expected. And because you haven't betrayed my expectations... I should thank you instead. Go. I won't take your life, but that's the limit of my mercy.

children.text: Why not stand with me against Tatalov?

children.speaker: Garboski
children.line: Countless years of captivity have whittled flat my edges. My prime is long past, never to return. I only wish to past [ sic ] the rest of my life as a normal trashcan. Farewell, stranger.

speaker: Audience Can
line: You dealt with the sealed demon, Garboski? He is so powerful and so terrifying, but you defeated him... How magnificent of you!

speaker: Audience Can
line: You've won me over, along with many others. This item carries our high regard for you.

title: Step Description
content: You have collected sufficient Proofs of Trust — It is time to prove your strength to Shatana.

speaker: (Trailblazer)
line: ▶ (I've finally collected three Proofs of Trust... Let's go back and deliver them.)

text:
(Talk to Shatana)
(If the player collects five Proof of Trust)

children.speaker: Shatana
children.line: Impressive... It's hard to believe you've collected all the Proofs of Trust. Your determination is truly admirable...

children.speaker: Shatana
children.line: Excellent. Looks like you've held up your side of the deal...

speaker: Shatana
line: ...I've waited so long for this day. Here, I'll escort you to your throne, the Pillars of Creation , where you'll witness the future of my people...

speaker: Shatana
line: I wish you success.

title: Step Description
content: Before you arrive at the Pillars of Creation, a huge number of trashcans yearning for freedom have already engaged Tatalov the Garbage King in a ferocious battle. Your arrival is certain to help them turn the tide of battle.

speaker: (Trailblazer)
line: ▶ (Is this where the final battle will take place... Not sure how I feel about this...)

speaker: (Trailblazer)
line: ▶ (Such a tragic scene...)

speaker: (Trailblazer)
line: ▶ (...Didn't they say the Garbage King would wait for me here?)

speaker: (Trailblazer)
line: ▶ (Have I been set up?)

children.speaker: Firefly
children.line: Hey, wait!

children.speaker: Firefly
children.line: What kind of nonsense is this?

speaker: Sampo
line: ▶ What a bummer... I was really looking forward to seeing how (Trailblazer) was going to overthrow the Garbage King...

text: I'd easily finish him off with one punch.
The Garbage King? You're the real Garbage King!

speaker: Sampo
line: What a huge pity! Such a meaningful dream came to an abrupt halt because of Miss Firefly...

speaker: Sampo
line: ...I was looking forward to seeing your face when the truth dawned on you.

text: What are you trying to say?

children.speaker: Sampo
children.line: ...Trying to say? I'm not saying anything, I just want to reveal the truth...

text: Is this weird dream trying to hint at some hidden meaning?

children.speaker: Sampo
children.line: Hint at? No, more like reveal...

speaker: Sampo
line: Don't you want to find out the truth behind the dream? Don't let all the pretty scenery in the dream world distract you from your goal — as soon as you get complacent, you'll lose sight of the truth.

speaker: Sampo
line: Don't you think this dream bubble looks really similar to modern-day Penacony?

speaker: Sampo
line: A small stage is crowded with a bunch of scheming people. None of them want to be exposed under the spotlight, so they all push you to the front...

speaker: Sampo
line: You're not at home anymore kid — you've wandered into the depths of the unknown. Let me put it to you straight — don't let yourself get enticed by that glowing light. I'm going to be very disappointed if you get bamboozled by the likes of them.

text: What in the dream world are you talking about?

children.speaker: Sampo
children.line: Seems like you really do have no clue. Turn around and take a look...

text: Sampo, just what are you up to, exactly?

children.speaker: Sampo
children.line: Same as always, pal. If you still don't get it, just turn around and take a look...

speaker: Sampo
line: Is that girl still here?

speaker: Sampo
line: She claims to be a local but doesn't know how this world works — all she's got is street smarts. Who exactly is she? You don't find her the least bit... suspicious?

speaker: Sampo
line: You'd better hurry up and confront her if you have any questions. Don't let her off scot-free, haha.

speaker: Sampo
line: See you around, pal... Don't let me down.
